Posts.Content: Hello Jrip , I was also tnbc .I say was as, up to now it's all gone. Yeah! I'm waiting on my first mammogram results, but I have a feeling all's well. I also had a lumpectomy followed by 6 chemotherapy treatment's followed by 10 radiotherapy treatment's . I'm in my 6 months since it all ended, and I'm finally feeling good about myself. It's a long road but there is an end . goo
Posts.Title: Any Triple Negative survivors willing to calm me down!!??

Posts.Content: well done to you Julie I am also a survivor it's a good feeling. I was told last Thursday, just getting used to the idea. X
Posts.Title: I am a survivor!!

Posts.Content: my legs ached , well more my shins and the top of my legs so painful. I was told to keep moving if you can only walk a little way then do that. I know it hurts, it does get better though, I have the odd days now when my body aches all over not good, but it doesn't last. hope this helps
Posts.Title: legs aching

Posts.Content: this might sound weird but , the treatment I had brought on the menopause, so hot sweats day and night. I came on here for advice and was told about a magnet that you can buy from boots and you wear it in your knickers, however strange it may seem, it works. I don't have hot sweats of any kind at all, magic. They cost £28 but worth every penny. Good luck x
Posts.Title: night sweats

Posts.Content: my radiotherapy finished 3 weeks ago at the end of the second week under my boob went extremely red then it blistered, then the blisters popped, then it got infected, then I had antibiotics, now its very nearly all better. I too get the sweats, its been mentioned to get magnets from boots apparently it helps x
Posts.Title: Last radiotherapy tomorrow!

Posts.Content: I feel for you I had it real bad and much like yourself no5 was when I wanted to give up to. In regards to your toilet predicament , I didn't want to take more tablets medicines etc I wanted something more au natural. Flaxseed sprinkled on your cereal / yoghurt works a treat,also prunes . I would have dry porridge oats maybe 1 or 2 prunes chopped a tbsp flaxseed all mixed up with yoghurt. Its rather tasty and it'll have you going in no time. Good luck
Posts.Title: Endgame!!

Posts.Content: I feel for you I had it real bad and much like yourself no5 was when I wanted to give up to. In regards to your toilet predicament , I didn't want to take more tablets medicines etc I wanted something more au natural. Flaxseed sprinkled on your cereal / yoghurt works a treat,also prunes . I would have dry porridge oats maybe 1 or 2 prunes chopped a tbsp flaxseed all mixed up with yoghurt. Its rather tasty and it'll have you going in no time. Good luck
Posts.Title: Endgame!!

Posts.Content: hi, I was exactly the same but mine was at Christmas.        I'd got talking to a lady who was a treatment in front of me, anyhow I was telling her that my treatment takes me through Christmas and then the New year, it should all have been over before the New year, anyhow she said to me not to worry as this is only one Christmas and New year and that there'll be plenty more so try not to worry too much. She was right try not to focus on could be but more on what will be.it'll be over before you know it cx
Posts.Title: Hit a brick wall

Posts.Content: my place to let of steam is the bathroom. I tell everyone I'm going for a bath, I cry get angry then I relax . When I'm finished I feel a little better, put my smile on happy days . You are amazing, you'll have bad days , but you'll also have fab days , keep going . ( ) that should be a h
Posts.Title: grumpy bum

Posts.Content: Hi , I to have just returned back to work, I'm on my third week. I should work 5 days out of 7 , however I'm currently working 3hrs over 4 days. I started back on just 2 hrs. It's not so much the physical side to it it's more the mental side of it. My first day back I just wanted to run away and hide it was so overwhelming. Everyone at work has been lovely, my boss is being really supportive. I was on a trial in returning to work and was told it's best to start of slow and build up then to set yourself up for a fall because it's got to much. good l
Posts.Title: Back to work

Posts.Content: yay we can get through this xx :)
Posts.Title: gym

Posts.Content: I went back to the gym last week I did aqua fit for the over 50s , I thought that this would be nice and gentle with it being for the over 50s haha it wasn't, anyhow I did what I could rested when I needed to, all's well. My next class was Pilates & the instructor is brilliant & I did the class same scenario rested when I needed to etc. I've done the same 2 classes again this week and I found I could do a little more so happy me, my life is coming back
Posts.Title: gym

Posts.Content: Hi Lovelyburke ,I know exactly where your coming from. Whilst having chemotherapy I had the most horrendous pain in my back,(it was worse than labour pains) . Anyway I read up on muscle pain and everyone recommends Epson bath salt's , so that's what I did, the pain is still there just not as great. Then I started with leg pain,knees, shin's, ank le's, it's like I've turned into an old lady overnight. But I don't want to have to take prescription anything. So I popped along to H&B and they suggested magnesium, so I bought some & got another for a penny ( ha win) I've been taking them for about 3 weeks, it's still there but not as bad. When I get up in the morning I can walk, instead of a shuffle. So early days but hopefully it's an answer. goo
Posts.Title: Joint pain update

Posts.Content: hi sr23 , I have always suffered with heavy periods so I know where you're coming from. At the beginning of my chemotherapy journey I would have to wear both tampon and towel as your not always near a loo. It lasted around 2 months then stopped, I haven't seen anything since. However I always mentioned it to my oncologist & bc nurse, they never seemed overly concerned. But I would still let them know to give you peace of mind. :)
Posts.Title: periods

Posts.Content: k as some of you may know I've been using magnets to stop the hot flushes due to the menopause. Well I'm happy to report that it works I don't know how but it does, in the last few nights I've slept right through no night sweats for me yay. During the day I can feel one coming on but then nothing yay. Also if anyone gets a palpitation feeling with the sweat I don't not any more anyhow. I know it's only been a week but its all quite positive at the moment, so I would say to anyone who has these symptoms to pop off to boots and purchase one . :
Posts.Title: menopause the solution

Posts.Content: Thanks Liz , I think your right in that it could be fatigue. Its so annoying as in my head in more than able to do......., anyhow when I do it floor's me ...... Not good x
Posts.Title: body aches

Posts.Content: Thanks Millie will do, I just keep thinking that it's all normal. My hubby keeps telling me to talk about my " symptoms" instead of just shrugging it off
Posts.Title: body aches

Posts.Content: I got an infection about a week after I'd finished rads right under my boob it was rather painful. I was put on a course of antibiotics. But I was told to stop putting cream on as this only made it worse. Were all dif
Posts.Title: Breast skin after radiotherapy

Posts.Content: hi all, I've recently finished radiotherapy and my body is aching all over just wondering if this was quite normal. T
Posts.Title: body aches

Posts.Content: I feel for you forme FEC wad the worst ....no I tell a lie its all horrible..... But what you have to keep in the back of your head is that you've done one and you came through it. Yey . However you have to do it again, boo. But you will get through it. Next time you go see if someone's there that can do you a foot massage whilst having your treatment, they are so relaxing and can help you through. You are doing brilliantly and it's only a short time in the whole scheme of things.     ...
Posts.Title: chemo side effects

Posts.Content: Thanks guys I'll have a look into the magnesium. But I will mention it to my B.C. nurse x
Posts.Title: painful knees and shin's

Posts.Content: hi all, I know I've posted before over sore joint's and took it that it's part of the reaction to the treatment etc, however now I'm back at work not far off full time and I'm on my feet for most of the day , my knees and shin's are extremely sore. I've purchased Epsom salts to bathe in as this is supposed to ease aching joints. Not happened yet. Does anyone else have a solution x carol
Posts.Title: painful knees and shin's

Posts.Content: hi, I had a allergic reaction to this drug also. Almost immediately my face and neck went bright red I was very hot then I couldn't breathe. Needless to say they had to change the drug.
Posts.Title: Docetaxel - face and neck red - have you experienced this?

Posts.Content: I was diagnosed with TNBC , but right from the start I was told I'd have surgery, chemo, radiotherapy. I've had a couple of lymph nodes removed of which were clear, thankfully. I was 49 when I was diagnosed. So you just go with what your told . I was told the reason behind chemo is that if the cancer is hiding somewhere then the chemo seeks it out and destroys it, hahaha . All of my treatment is now over, yeah, and I go see my oncologist on Thursday this week, where hopefully she'll say it's all gone. Here's hoping. X goo luck
Posts.Title: Triple Negative Breast Cancer

Posts.Content: hello you lovely people, I'm due to have my oncology appointment tomorrow (Thursday) its my first appointment since I finished all of my treatment. Just wondering what happens or even what questions I should ask ?
Posts.Title: oncology appointment

Posts.Content: Good question Monika I'll write that one down x
Posts.Title: oncology appointment

Posts.Content: well Monica, I asked the question but the answer was we don't know, all she could say is that right now I DON'T have cancer YEAH . I'll have 6 monthly check ups one will be a mammogram the other appointment will be with the oncologist, so they don't completely let you go. Also I can still contact my Bcn if and when I need to. hope that eases any of your worries
Posts.Title: oncology appointment

Posts.Content: thanks All so much for your comments we are all truly happy. and breathe   good luck to everyone who's still battling, together we can do this xx
Posts.Title: survivor

Posts.Content: today I was told that all's well and that for now and I DON'T HAVE CANCER!!!!!! Yeah!!!!! celebrating at the moment with a cheeky glass of wine happy day's xxx
Posts.Title: survivor

Posts.Content: hi , sleep, rest when you have to, play when you can. I didn't work when I was going through treatment. Eat as well as you can rest as much as you can and don't feel guilty about it either, the house work can wait. You need your energy to get through this and you will, it's not going to last forever. Stay strong x
Posts.Title: energy levels ?

Posts.Content: thanks Della sometimes you think any pain is something else then you get told it's due to your treatment. It's never quite finally over is it
Posts.Title: dodgy knees

Posts.Content: thanks ladies I've been trying to cope with the pain but today I've had to take ibuprofen and codeine. Didn't think about cod liver oil I'll have a look into them as I'm not one to take medicine if I can help it. But it's nice to know I'm not on my own and that in some weird way its normal. Xx
Posts.Title: dodgy knees

Posts.Content: hi anyone having or indeed had problems with their knees. Mine hurt if I've crossed my legs uncrossing them is painful like wise stairs are a problem up or down this also hurts. I finished chemo in January and rads in February . Any help would be greatly appreciated xx
Posts.Title: dodgy knees
